content.description: Begin with a hands free start on the slab face. Make a long reach for the first crack, then get some fat smears to reach for the next crack towards the left. Move your feet up into the first crack for the easy topout!
content.location: The slab face is to the right of the overhanging face.

content.description: The Floor is Lava is an instant Cape Classic and gets its name because the lower slab that the overhang is pitched upon is OFF. Do the same start as Drummer Boy Bulge, and do the same move to the double sidepull. Then make a big throw to the jug flake on the overhang, throw a high left heel on the double sidepull to match your hands on the jug, and unlock the left heel for a big swing to the right. Then, throw to the jug on the top of the overhang. Finish with another VERY sketchy topout to give it the V4 grade.
content.location: Use the same start as Drummer Boy Bulge, and traverse left-to-right across the overhang face. The lower slab that the overhang is pitched upon is OFF.

content.description: Start on two negative crimps just left of the left arete. Straddle the arete with your feet with your left foot on a small flake and your right foot on the overhanging face. Make a powerful move up with your right hand to a gaston, match, then bump your  right hand over to the sidepull. Use some tricky feet (try a left heel in the right hand starting hold), a few powerful moves to sloped out crimps, a high right foot, and go for the sketchy topout!
content.location: Looking at the overhanging face, start on the left face, then climb up the left arete.

content.description: Drummer Boy is a nice park with a sweet, “uncharted” boulder right next to the parking lot. It’s clear that others have messed around on this rock before, but I thought it finally deserves to be here on Mountain Project.
